content: the toe as shown in photo below ©ashleymaglich round 1 ch1 single_crochet in that same stitch single_crochet in the next stitch skip the next stitch & repeat all the way around single_crochet next 2 stitches skip the next when you have 24 stitches you will now be at the bottom of the stocking ©ashleymaglich you will place a single_crochet on each side of the single_crochet where you stitched the stocking together *pictured below* slip_stitch in the first single_crochet & ch1 you should have 26 stitches round 2 1/2dc in that same stitch 1/2dc next 2 stitches 2 1/2dc in the next repeat that all the way around until you have 2 stitches left 1/2dc nxt 3 2 1/2dc nxt ©ashleymaglich make a 1 1/2dc in each of the last 2 stitches 32 stitches slip_stitch into first 1/2dc ch1 round 3 1/2dc in the next 2 stitches 1/2dc 2 together repeat all the way around 24 stitches slip_stitch in the first 1/2dc ch1 ©ashleymaglich round 4 1/2dc 1/2dc 2 together repeat all the way around 16 stitches slip_stitch in the first 1/2dc ch1 ©ashleymaglich round 5 1/2dc 2 together all the way around 8 stitches slip_stitch into first stitch ch1 *now at this point i cut my yarn & sew up the end of the toe if you feel more comfortable slip stitching instead you can definitely do that ©ashleymaglich leave a long tail & cut your yarn you will now use your darning needle to weave in & out of the 8 stitches & cinch the center closed make sure you weave your ends in well so the toe of your stocking doesn t come undone ©ashleymaglich your stocking is now complete i will show you how i make the tag to hang the stocking if you don t want to crochet the hanger you can certainly use ribbon or fabric if you would like tag make a slip knot on your hook & chain 16 1/2dc in the second chain from the hook ©ashleymaglich 1/2dc in each stitch all the way down ch1 & fo make sure you leave a decently long tail because you will need that to sew it onto the stocking now your going to fold the strip you have where the ends meet each other to form your tag i like to thread my yarn through so that the ends stay put ©ashleymaglich now you just place this tag in the stocking where you d like i like to flatten the side of my stocking where you sewn it together so you can have a nice area to work with place your tag & just sew it in place ©ashleymaglich once you are satisfied with your tag you can now fold your stocking back to its shape ©ashleymaglich your stocking is now complete i hope you enjoyed this project you can also add crochet or felt appliques to these i would love to hear how your project turned out you can find me over on
